items.name: quick_start
items.title: Quick start
items.description: This quick start guide show how to test quicly ParaViewWeb locally.

items.name: architecture
items.title: Architecture
items.description: This guide goes through the design evolution while explaining why we made certain choices.

items.name: multi_user_setup
items.title: Multi-User Setup
items.description: This document explains the three required components for multi-user ParaViewWeb

items.name: apache_front_end
items.title: Apache as a front end
items.description: This document explains how to use Apache as a front end in conjunction with a launcher.

items.name: launcher_api
items.title: Launcher RESTful API
items.description: This document explains the RESTful API which must be implemented by any launcher.

items.name: python_launcher
items.title: Python Launcher
items.description: This document explains how to use the provided Python Launcher for ParaViewWeb.

items.name: jetty_session_manager
items.title: Jetty Launcher
items.description: This document explains how to use the Jetty Session Manager for ParaViewWeb.

items.name: launching_examples
items.title: Launching Examples
items.description: This document describes some of the possible depoyment configurations that can be achieved with the supplied launchers.

items.name: pvw_setup
items.title: ParaViewWeb
items.description: This document covers the various ways of obtaining, configuring, building, and running ParaViewWeb

items.name: graphics_on_ec2_g2
items.title: EC2 Graphics Setup
items.description: This document describes how to set up a graphics card on various kinds of g2.2xlarge instances.

items.name: os_mesa
items.title: Offscreen OSMesa
items.description: This document explains how to build ParaViewWeb with support for OSMesa.

items.name: virtualgl_turbovnc_howto
items.title: VirtualGL and TurboVNC
items.description: This document explains how to set up ParaViewWeb to do hardware-accelerated, offscreen rendering.

items.name: ubuntu_14_04
items.title: Ubuntu 14.04 LTS
items.description: This document explains how to setup a ParaViewWeb server on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS Desktop.

items.name: app_gallery
items.title: Gallery
items.description: This guide illustrates some of the applications which have been built with ParaViewWeb.

items.name: parallel_app
items.title: Parallel Visualization
items.description: This document explains how to set up the Parallel Web application in order to load data on a visualization cluster.

items.name: ipython
items.title: ParaViewWeb inside iPython
items.description: This documentation explain how to setup iPython/notebook along ParaViewWeb with distributed MPI engines and live visualization.

items.name: build_vtk_web
items.title: Configure and build VTK
items.description: This document explains how to configure and build VTK from source

items.name: configure_and_build
items.title: Configure and build Paraview
items.description: This document explains how to configure and build ParaView from source.

items.name: developer_howto
items.title: Introduction for developers
items.description: Components break down and introduction of ParaViewWeb's pieces.

items.name: developer_style
items.title: Code Style Guidelines
items.description: Coding style guidelines intended for developers contributing to ParaViewWeb.

items.name: webtest_setup
items.title: Setting up a machine for Web-based Testing
items.description: This document explains how to set up a computer to be able to run web-based tests.

items.name: auto_deploy_update
items.title: Automatic deployment and updates
items.description: This document describes an approach to setting up automatic updates and deployment of ParaViewWeb.
